name: Smoke Gets in Your Eyes
summary: At an advertising agency in 1960s Manhattan, the creative director has problems coming up with ideas for a tobacco account and crosses swords with the female head of a large department store that she wants to take in a new retail direction.

name: Ladies Room
summary: Betty sees a specialist about her ongoing physical problems; a managing partner leans on Don to get involved in the Richard Nixon presidential campaign; Peggy gets some unwanted attention from a copy writer.

name: Marriage of Figaro
summary: Pete's return from his honeymoon stirs up conflicted emotions about his bachelor-party dalliance with Peggy; Don and Rachel's business relationship shifts; Betty sets tongues wagging when she invites the neighborhood divorcée to her daughter's birthday party.

name: New Amsterdam
summary: Pete oversteps his bounds in dealing with a valuable client, puts his foot in his mouth and gets a lesson from Don in toeing the company line. At home, he gets pressure from his newlywed bride to buy their own apartment unit.

name: Five G
summary: Don wins a prestigious award and gets his face splashed on a prominent industry periodical, which triggers some fallout from his past; Ken gets a short story published in a national monthly magazine, inspiring jealousy among his colleagues.

name: Babylon
summary: Peggy offers superb suggestions during a focus-group session, and her ideas are so well received that her future at the agency looks much brighter; Don asks Rachel's advice about an ad campaign for Israeli tourism.

name: Red in the Face
summary: A boys' night out for Roger and Don ends badly as Roger's erratic behavior damages their relationship; Pete encounters problems on the home front as he and his bride continue to adjust to being married.

name: The Hobo Code
summary: Don's mysterious past comes back to haunt him; Peggy celebrates her new work success, but not all of her colleagues and co-workers are pleased or impressed; Salvatore's relationship with a client is questioned.

name: Shoot
summary: A rival ad agency tries to poach Don from Sterling Cooper, and they involve Betty in their campaign to land him; romantic rivals vie for Peggy's affections. Also, the agency steps up its Nixon presidential campaign in an attempt to counter successful Kennedy promos.

name: Long Weekend
summary: Don is distraught about losing an important account, so Roger, stuck in the city on Labor Day, tries to cheer him up; Joan and her roommate paint the town.

name: Indian Summer
summary: Peggy is assigned a difficult project; Don seizes the opportunity provided by Roger's latest work woes; a frustrated Pete develops more problems at home and in the office; Betty seeks new relief for her mounting frustrations.

name: Nixon vs. Kennedy
summary: The Sterling Cooper staff pulls an all-nighter watching Nixon-Kennedy election returns; an ambitious Pete directly challenges Don.

name: The Wheel
summary: Peggy's colleagues are irked when she's given a new job opportunity; Don's work responsibilities get in the way of his home life; Betty uncovers a surprising secret.

name: For Those Who Think Young
summary: The second season opens with Don butting heads about personnel matters with Duck, who wants "younger creative talent"; the staff is up in the air about its approach to an airline-company account; Betty bumps into a former roommate who has begun a surprising new career; Joan is at a loss about where to put the new copy machine.

name: Flight 1
summary: Paul throws a party, then throws his work colleagues for a loop when he introduces them to a special guest; Peggy pays a dinner visit to her family; Duck uses an unorthodox approach to land an airline account, which puts the firm on a conflict-of-interest course.

name: The Benefactor
summary: Problems surface on the set of a commercial shoot while Don plays hooky from the office; ever-ambitious, career-minded Harry musters support for a sponsorship plagued by controversy; Betty steps in to help Don when he arranges a dinner to placate his upset clients.

name: Three Sundays
summary: Peggy's family entertains a new priest assigned to their parish; Freddy and Ken wine and dine a client; the agency staff pitches in to prepare for an under-the-gun pitch meeting.

name: The New Girl
summary: Joan might have found Don a perfect secretary; Peggy comes to the rescue when Don finds himself in the middle of personal issues between a TV comedian and the man's wife; Pete and his wife see a fertility specialist to deal with her inability to conceive.

name: Maidenform
summary: Don and Duck attempt to make peace at the office; Peggy tries to find a way to participate in the high-level after-hours meetings being held by the executives; one of Duck's family members visits his office.

name: The Gold Violin
summary: Don steps up in class and purchases a new set of wheels that is more appropriate for a big-time executive; Pete, Harry and Ken put their heads together to land new accounts; a serious error by Don's secretary could reflect poorly on Joan; the staff reacts to the new objet d'art in Cooper's office.

name: A Night to Remember
summary: Father Gill tries to convince Peggy to volunteer her talents to a church project; Duck and Don team to woo a foreign-beer client by marketing to a new demographic; Harry turns to an unlikely source for help when his department is overloaded with work.

name: Six Month Leave
summary: Freddy Rumsen strikes out during a pitch meeting with his team; ever-eager Pete seizes a chance to exploit an opportunity at the office; an old friend is the beneficiary of Don's loyalty; Sara Beth proves to be a welcome ally for Betty.

name: The Inheritance
summary: Betty visits her ailing father; Paul's girlfriend, Sheila, advises him about his civic responsibilities; Pete's mother tries to put the kibosh on an important family move that he and Trudy are planning.

name: The Jet Set
summary: Don takes a business trip to Los Angeles, where he hooks up with some interesting new acquaintances; Peggy's in the mood for an office romance; Duck contemplates the future at Sterling Cooper.

name: The Mountain King
summary: An old friend and Don renew acquaintances; Pete's personal problems impact a major account; Joan introduces her fiancé around the office.

name: Meditations in an Emergency
summary: As the second season ends, things get bumpy at Sterling Cooper while Don is away; Betty receives some upsetting news.

name: Out of Town
summary: In the third-season opener, Pete and Ken are among those affected by the corporate changes at the firm. Meanwhile, Sal accompanies Don on a business trip to Baltimore, where both men succumb to the powers of persuasive seduction.

name: Love Among the Ruins
summary: Betty's father pays a visit; the Drapers dine with the stuffy new British boss (Jared Harris) and his snobby wife; the firm contemplates whether to accede to an unusual request from a client; Roger takes charge of arranging a wedding; and Peggy's personal involvement in a campaign leaves her greatly affected.

name: My Old Kentucky Home
summary: A mandatory overtime session leaves the writers trying to stave off late-night boredom; Roger throws a party, and Joan and Greg host one of their own; and Sally and Grandpa have a run-in.

name: The Arrangements
summary: Don crosses paths with his father-in-law (Ryan Cutrona); Peggy searches for a new roommate; and a new client with money to throw around is very excited about doing business with the firm.

name: The Fog
summary: Concern over Sally's behavior causes Don and Betty to act; opportunistic Pete tries to work a new angle into his business dealings; and an odd dream has a strange effect on Betty.

name: Guy Walks Into an Advertising Agency
summary: A surprise visitor shows up at Sterling Cooper; Sally gets spooked by something (or someone); and Joan is the recipient of some surprising news.

name: Seven Twenty Three
summary: Betty becomes involved in local politics; a troubling incident leads Don to begin thinking about his future; and Peggy is on the receiving end of an exquisite gift.

name: Souvenir
summary: Don decides to include Betty on a company business trip; Pete lends a hand to a neighbor in his apartment building.

name: Wee Small Hours
summary: Client satisfaction proves to be difficult for both Don and Sal; Betty decides to host a fund-raiser.

name: The Color Blue
summary: Sterling Cooper celebrates a company milestone; Peggy competes with Paul for an account.

name: The Gypsy and the Hobo
summary: Sterling Cooper welcomes back a prodigal client; Betty and the children take a trip; Joan and Greg make plans for their future.

name: The Grown-Ups
summary: A candidate makes an impression on Don; Peggy's taste in men proves questionable; and Pete faces a major decision about his career.

name: Shut the Door. Have a Seat.
summary: In the third-season finale, Don has a pivotal meeting with Connie (Chelcie Ross); Betty is the beneficiary of some interesting advice; and Pete has a serious sit-down with some clients.

name: Public Relations
summary: In the Season 4 opener, Don's reluctance to talk about himself jettisons a prestigious trade-paper interview that the company was hoping would be a boon to business. Meanwhile, the "wholesome" manufacturer of two-piece swimsuits wants to hire the firm but doesn't want a sexy ad campaign; Pete and Peggy stage a stunt in an effort to secure more money from a meat-company client; and Roger plays Cupid for Don.

name: Christmas Comes But Once a Year
summary: The agency's Christmas party is nearly spoiled by the late arrival of a surprise and not-so-welcome visitor.

name: The Good News
summary: Don plans a jaunt to Acapulco, while back at the office, Lane and Joan get into a serious disagreement.

name: The Rejected
summary: When Pete receives an edict from Roger and Lane, he finds himself confronting personal dilemmas at work and on the home front. Meanwhile, Peggy befriends Joyce, a photo editor at Life magazine, who invites the copywriter to a party at a downtown loft, where Peggy gets hit on from a number of sides. And Faye's self-deprecating remarks at a focus-group meeting don't sit well with Don.

name: The Chrysanthemum and the Sword
summary: Don and Pete disregard Roger's expectations in an effort to land an important new client.

name: Waldorf Stories
summary: Peggy and her new creative partner don't see eye-to-eye; Don pitches a client under an unusual set of circumstances.

name: The Suitcase
summary: : A rapidly approaching deadline causes consternation and throws things into a tizzy at the agency.

name: The Summer Man
summary: Peggy and Joan are forced to deal with some insulting office behavior; Don and his date Bethany (Anna Camp) have an uncomfortable encounter with Betty and her husband at a fancy restaurant. Later, during a late-night business meeting, Don invites Faye (Cara Buono) to dine with him, and dinner turns into a bit more than either had expected.

name: The Beautiful Girls
summary: A romantic gesture in the form of a thoughtful gift could lead to professional problems for Peggy.

name: Hands and Knees
summary: Betty is a bit unsettled when a surprise visitor stops at the Francis home.

name: Chinese Wall
summary: An all-hands meeting is called at Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce, and the gossip starts to fly about an important client leaving the agency and that possibly more will follow. Meanwhile, a competing firm attempts to poach select SCDP employees; Peggy has a passionate romp with Abe and later tries her hand at wooing the Playtex people.

name: Blowing Smoke
summary: While trying to navigate a crisis, Don encounters an old friend.

name: Tomorrowland
summary: In the Season 4 finale, a surprising opportunity rears its head for both Don and Peggy, leaving them with life-altering decisions to make.

name: A Little Kiss (1)
summary: Don is greeted with a surprise; Roger and Pete clash; and Joan has a run-in with a houseguest.

name: A Little Kiss (2)
summary: Don is greeted with a surprise; Roger and Pete clash; and Joan has a run-in with a houseguest.

name: Tea Leaves
summary: Peggy receives new responsibilities as the firm makes a concentrated push to increase business. Later, Don and Harry go the extra mile for a big client.

name: Mystery Date
summary: Don has an encounter with someone from the past; Joan comes to a momentous decision. Meanwhile, Roger increases Peggy's workload.

name: Signal 30
summary: Lane makes an interesting friend; Pete plays host to an assortment of guests.

name: Far Away Places
summary: Peggy has a tough time during a particularly formidable pitch; Don calls on a potential client.

name: At the Codfish Ball
summary: Don, Roger and Pete team up to rustle up some new clients; Sally lends a hand to a relative.

name: Lady Lazarus
summary: Peggy reluctantly harbors a secret; Pete steps up for a friend; Don gets a surprise.

name: Dark Shadows
summary: Don's competitive nature comes to the fore; Roger pursues some new clients; Sally is met with a challenge.

name: Christmas Waltz
summary: Christmas proves rewarding to many at the agency; Harry does a good turn for a friend.

name: The Other Woman
summary: Don deals with a challenging pitch, while Peggy ponders taking a trip.

name: Commissions and Fees
summary: Don receives an intriguing lead and follows up on it.

name: The Phantom
summary: Season 5 concludes with opportunities abounding for everyone at the agency, while Pete encounters an interesting stranger on a train.

name: The Doorway (1)
summary: Don launches a new campaign in the sixth-series opener.

name: The Doorway (2)
summary: Roger receives some unnerving news; and Betty welcomes a houseguest.

name: The Collaborators
summary: Don has a difference of opinion with a client, while Peggy has problems motivating the staff.

name: To Have and to Hold
summary: The partners try to keep a secret campaign under wraps, while Joan gets a visit from an old friend.

name: The Flood
summary: Peggy plans for the future, while Roger courts a potential client.

name: For Immediate Release
summary: Roger changes tack to make new business; Pete has an awkward run-in with a client.

name: Man With a Plan
summary: Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce tries to placate competing clients; Pete is blindsided by an unexpected guest.

name: The Crash
summary: Don is disrupted by a surprise visitor; Peggy looks for inspiration.

name: The Better Half
summary: Roger is plagued by a recurring dream; Joan goes to the beach.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
summary: The agency works to keep a client; Joan is caught off guard.

name: Favors
summary: etty plans for Sally's future, while Peggy encounters trouble at home.

name: The Quality of Mercy
summary: The partners disagree on a new campaign; Don takes a day off.

name: In Care Of
summary: In the series 6 finale, Don has a problem.

name: Time Zones
summary: The Season 7 opener finds Don making a new friend, and Joan meeting a client for drinks. Elsewhere, Peggy hears some impressive new work, and Roger experiences a strange phone call.

name: A Day's Work
summary: Peggy receives flowers at the office; Pete navigates the politics of new business; Joan is put in an awkward situation.

name: Field Trip
summary: Don takes an impromptu trip; Betty has lunch with a friend; Harry lobbies for a cause; the partners consider a questionable asset.

name: The Monolith
summary: Sterling Cooper & Partners prepares for a guest; Don calls an old friend; Roger confronts problems at home; Pete underestimates Peggy.

name: The Runaways
summary: Don gets a visitor from his past; Stan embarrasses a superior; Peggy helps Ginsberg with a problem; Harry discovers a new ally at the agency.

name: The Strategy
summary: Peggy does research for a pitch; Pete is invited to join an exclusive club; Joan seeks time spent with a friend.

name: Waterloo
summary: Don receives a troubling letter; Pete butts heads with Cutler; Roger gets an unexpected phone call; and a risky venture entails a new future for Peggy.

name: Severance
summary: Don tries to track down a friend; Joan struggles to solve a problem with an account; Peggy is set up by an unlikely person.

name: New Business
summary: Roger gives Don some unwanted advice; Peggy and Stan disagree over an account's personnel; Harry asks for Don's blessing.

name: The Forecast
summary: Roger pawns off a project onto Don; Joan goes on a business trip; Peggy and Pete clash over how to deal with an account emergency.

name: Time & Life
summary: Don comes up with a big idea; Roger asks Joan for help with a clerical error; Peggy has a hard time with casting for a commercial.

name: Lost Horizon
summary: Don receives a reward for his work; Joan butts heads with a coworker on an account; Roger dodges a big decision.

name: The Milk and Honey Route
summary: Don has trouble sleeping; Pete is blindsided by a friend; Henry arranges a family reunion.

name: Person to Person
summary: The stories of Don Draper, his family and his coworkers come to an end in the series finale.
